Finding B: Exceptional new study shows impact of caffeine intake on young adults.

Finding A: Duplicate testing occurred in 27/85 (32%) patients and was categorized as \'not clinically indicated\' in 17/ 85 (20%) patients (table 2).
Finding B: The research demonstrated that NPP is able to significantly outperform the current state-of-the-art methods in predicting node degree centrality.

Computer_Science_tweet_58_r$Computer_Sci.text:
Finding A: "In short term in-clinic testing, energy savings were substantial (38%–45%), and therapeutic efficacy [of DBS] was maintained." This is a BIG DEAL. Battery drain is associated with worsening symptoms in DSB. Longer battery life = better quality of life.
Finding B: It seemed that the longer someone had been driving a taxi, the larger his hippocampus, as though the brain expanded to accommodate the cognitive demands of navigating London's streets.
Finding C: Most networks don't look scale-free at all."
Finding D: New dorsal/ventral distinction in macaque medial PFC - DMFC signals errors, and ACC integrates errors to drive task switches. Very nice work showing causal relationship, organizes a lot of literature @username
Computer_Science_tweet_58_r$Computer_Sci.displayed_text:
Finding A: "In short term in-clinic testing, energy savings were substantial (38%–45%), and therapeutic efficacy [of DBS] was maintained." This is a BIG DEAL. Battery drain is associated with worsening symptoms in DSB. Longer battery life = better quality of life.
Finding B: It seemed that the longer someone had been driving a taxi, the larger his hippocampus, as though the brain expanded to accommodate the cognitive demands of navigating London's streets.
Finding C: Most networks don't look scale-free at all."
Finding D: New dorsal/ventral distinction in macaque medial PFC - DMFC signals errors, and ACC integrates errors to drive task switches. Very nice work showing causal relationship, organizes a lot of literature @username

Computer_Science_100_p$Computer_Science_.text:
Finding A: Hyperspectral imaging can be a very powerful tool to phenotype biochemical traits of the whole maize plants, complementing RGB for plant morphological trait analysis.
Finding B: The motivational impact of social incentives, coupled with sufficient tax breaks or additional advantages coming from customers, regulators, or investors, would make them as effective for employers as offering financial incentives."
Finding C: These results show that mixed-reality led to more learning than screen only, for both the mousecontrol and physical-control conditions ( Figure 10 ).
Finding D: If we allow people to retract recently posted comments, then we may be able to minimize regret from posting in the heat of the moment.
Computer_Science_100_p$Computer_Science_.displayed_text:
Finding A: Hyperspectral imaging can be a very powerful tool to phenotype biochemical traits of the whole maize plants, complementing RGB for plant morphological trait analysis.
Finding B: The motivational impact of social incentives, coupled with sufficient tax breaks or additional advantages coming from customers, regulators, or investors, would make them as effective for employers as offering financial incentives."
Finding C: These results show that mixed-reality led to more learning than screen only, for both the mousecontrol and physical-control conditions ( Figure 10 ).
Finding D: If we allow people to retract recently posted comments, then we may be able to minimize regret from posting in the heat of the moment.

Computer_Science_289_r$Computer_Science_.text:
Finding A: It seemed that the longer someone had been driving a taxi, the larger his hippocampus, as though the brain expanded to accommodate the cognitive demands of navigating London\'s streets.
Finding B: Saying "Excuse me" to take a call didn\'t cut it: over 30 percent still found it to be rarely/never appropriate during informal/offsite lunch meetings.
Finding C: Defining the algorithms that will help AVs make these moral decisions is a formidable challenge.
Finding D: The results of our study suggest that not all lies are bad or necessarily socially destructive; in fact, it seems that some lies may even enhance the cohesion of the society as a whole and help to create links with other people.
Computer_Science_289_r$Computer_Science_.displayed_text:
Finding A: It seemed that the longer someone had been driving a taxi, the larger his hippocampus, as though the brain expanded to accommodate the cognitive demands of navigating London\'s streets.
Finding B: Saying "Excuse me" to take a call didn\'t cut it: over 30 percent still found it to be rarely/never appropriate during informal/offsite lunch meetings.
Finding C: Defining the algorithms that will help AVs make these moral decisions is a formidable challenge.
Finding D: The results of our study suggest that not all lies are bad or necessarily socially destructive; in fact, it seems that some lies may even enhance the cohesion of the society as a whole and help to create links with other people.

Computer_Science_406_r$Computer_Science_.text:
Finding A: Given these substantial costs and limitations, it is noteworthy that there is little consistent evidence that filtering is effective at shielding young people from online sexual material.
Finding B: When compared to women, men are almost twice as likely to find things like texting or answering calls appropriate in an informal meeting: USC There's also a massive difference based on age.
Finding C: A game that combined real-world experiments with interactions on a computer tablet improved learning by almost five times more than screen-only alternatives.
Finding D: On the basis of these results, we suggested that learning, representing and using a spatial representation of a highly complex and large-scale environment is a primary function of the posterior hippocampus in humans such that this brain region might adapt structurally to accommodate its elaboration.

Finding C: A game that combined real-world experiments with interactions on a computer tablet improved learning by almost five times more than screen-only alternatives.
Finding D: On the basis of these results, we suggested that learning, representing and using a spatial representation of a highly complex and large-scale environment is a primary function of the posterior hippocampus in humans such that this brain region might adapt structurally to accommodate its elaboration.

Computer_Science_306_r$Computer_Science_.text:
Finding A: These new second laws are generally not noticeable except on very small scales, at which point, they become increasingly important.
Finding B: When groups are forced to go head-to-head with each other, we expect those composed of men to exhibit higher levels of creativity relative to groups composed of women.
Finding C: With a national sample of more than 550 full-time working professionals, the study reveals what business professionals perceive as acceptable, courteous or rude use of mobile phones in the workplace.
Finding D: Our analysis suggests that papers with shorter titles do receive greater numbers of citations.
